instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the models comparing SOC predictions, and how far can this metric go?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the models comparing SOC predictions using pXRF measured data and the Cubist algorithm is the mean absolute error (MAE), root mean square error (RMSE), and coefficient of determination (R-2). These metrics provide a measure of the accuracy, precision, and goodness-of-fit of the models. 

The extent to which these metrics can go in evaluating the models depends on the specific context and requirements of the study. In this particular study, the MAE, RMSE, and R-2 values were used to compare the performance of three different Cubist models.
